body: Allowing for more complex and intuitive search possibilities, replacing the Exclude Selected with a checkbox, and switching it to Exclude Unselected, will allow for AND, OR, NOT combinations.
author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)
title: Replace 'Exclude Selected' with 'Exclude Unselected' and make it a checkbox in the Filter options

comments.body:
TBH, I think this would be very confusing. Exclude Unselected is a double negative isn't it? Then you can switch it on or off!! My head hurts! Perhaps some examples would help...

**Owner:** lodici123
comments.author: [lodici123](https://code.google.com/u/lodici123/)

comments.body:
Hehe, yeah, would probably help to explain that further:

I'm wanting to make a White and Blue deck:-
Selecting White and Blue in the color filters and choosing:

'Match any' will also show White and Green cards, and Blue and Red cards (an OR selection for example).
I don't want those so I then choose.

'Match All Selected' This shows me all cards with White AND Blue, and other colors. So White, Green, and Blue cards are shown.

Still not what I want to see.

So I then have to select Black, Red, Green then select the Exclude Selected - Just to see the cards to go in a White Blue deck (This also then shows all the Artifacts and Land as well)

So as I have to select the colors I don't want to use in a deck to show the cards I do want in a deck. Not very intuitive.

It would make sense for the Exclude Selected to instead be a checkbox, so I can select the colors I want, select 'Match Any', and then an extra filter of 'Exclude Unselected' to filter out the other colors I haven't selected.

Hope that's clearer - Just something that's always annoyed me when making a deck :)
comments.author: [ShawnieBoyUK](https://code.google.com/u/ShawnieBoyUK/)

comments.body: Thanks - that explains the problem clearly.
